evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Article III of the Treaty excludes Indigenous people from paying duty on goods carried across the border: ... Nor shall the Indians passing or repassing with their own proper Goods and Effects of whatever nature, pay for the same any Impost or Duty whatever.

extracted.value: Exemption from tariffs under Jay Treaty of 1794, which allows Indigenous people to cross U.S.-Canada border duty-free

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Plaintiffs challenge the constitutionality of Executive Order 14193 (February 1, 2025) ... Proclamation 10896 (steel) and Proclamation 10895 (aluminum) ... Executive Order issued April 2, 2025 (Regulating Imports with a Reciprocal Tariff to Rectify Trade Practices that Contribute to Large and Persistent Annual United States Goods Trade Deficits).

extracted.value: Challenging Executive Order 14193 (as amended), Proclamation 10896 (steel), Proclamation 10895 (aluminum), and Executive Order on Reciprocal Tariffs issued April 2, 2025

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Plaintiff Jonathan St. Goddard is a rancher... has had to pay tariffs on replacement tractor parts that have increased the cost of ranching... Plaintiff has had to pay tariffs on replacement tractor parts that have increased the cost of ranching and doing business and caused direct harm.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Plaintiff Susan Webber is an enrolled member of the Blackfeet Nation and an elected representative... represents businesses that regularly do business across the border of Canada, import goods for the tribal community, and for personal use, and who are injured by the tariffs in their personal and business lives.

extracted.value: Plaintiffs Susan Webber (tribal representative) and Jonathan St. Goddard (rancher) directly harmed by tariffs on cross-border business and personal goods
